Paragraph: The JSON-Java package is a reference implementation that demonstrates how to parse JSON documents into Java objects and how to generate new JSON documents from the Java classes.
Ground truth tasks: generate new json documents from java classes
Program tasks: generate new json documents from java classes

Paragraph: The files in this package implement JSON encoders and decoders. The package can also convert between JSON and XML, HTTP headers, Cookies, and CDL.
Ground truth tasks:
implement json encorders
implement decoders
convert between cdl
convert between json
convert between xml
convert between http headers
convert between cookies
Program tasks:
implement json encoders
implement decoders
convert  between cdl
convert  between json
convert  between xml
convert  between http headers
convert  between cookies

Paragraph: The org.json package can be built from the command line, Maven, and Gradle. The unit tests can be executed from Maven, Gradle, or individually in an IDE e.g. Eclipse.
Ground truth tasks:
execute unit tests from maven
execute unit tests from gradle
Program tasks:
execute unit tests from e.g. eclipse
execute unit tests from maven
execute unit tests from gradle

Paragraph: Create the jar file in the current directory
Ground truth tasks: create jar file in current directory
Program tasks: create jar file in current directory

Paragraph: Compile a program that uses the jar (see example code below)
Program tasks:
compile program
use jar
use program

For example, code like this will create a mixed JSONArray, some items wrapped, others not:

JSONObject.java: The JSONObject can parse text from a String or a JSONTokener to produce a map-like object. The object provides methods for manipulating its contents, and for producing a JSON compliant object serialization.

JSONObject.java: The JSONObject can parse text from a String or a JSONTokener to produce a map-like object. The object provides methods for manipulating its contents, and for producing a JSON compliant object serialization.

JSONObject.java: The JSONObject can parse text from a String or a JSONTokener to produce a map-like object. The object provides methods for manipulating its contents, and for producing a JSON compliant object serialization.

JSONArray.java: The JSONArray can parse text from a String or a JSONTokener to produce a vector-like object. The object provides methods for manipulating its contents, and for producing a JSON compliant array serialization.

JSONArray.java: The JSONArray can parse text from a String or a JSONTokener to produce a vector-like object. The object provides methods for manipulating its contents, and for producing a JSON compliant array serialization.

JSONArray.java: The JSONArray can parse text from a String or a JSONTokener to produce a vector-like object. The object provides methods for manipulating its contents, and for producing a JSON compliant array serialization.

JSONTokener.java: The JSONTokener breaks a text into a sequence of individual tokens. It can be constructed from a String, Reader, or InputStream. It also can parse text from a String, Number, Boolean or null like ""hello"", 42, true, null to produce a simple json object.

JSONTokener.java: The JSONTokener breaks a text into a sequence of individual tokens. It can be constructed from a String, Reader, or InputStream. It also can parse text from a String, Number, Boolean or null like ""hello"", 42, true, null to produce a simple json object.

JSONTokener.java: The JSONTokener breaks a text into a sequence of individual tokens. It can be constructed from a String, Reader, or InputStream. It also can parse text from a String, Number, Boolean or null like ""hello"", 42, true, null to produce a simple json object.

JSONTokener.java: The JSONTokener breaks a text into a sequence of individual tokens. It can be constructed from a String, Reader, or InputStream. It also can parse text from a String, Number, Boolean or null like ""hello"", 42, true, null to produce a simple json object.
JSONString.java: The JSONString interface requires a toJSONString method, allowing an object to provide its own serialization.
JSONStringer.java: The JSONStringer provides a convenient facility for building JSON strings.
JSONWriter.java: The JSONWriter provides a convenient facility for building JSON text through a writer.
